<a id="FontVariation"></a>

# FontVariation

**Inherits:** [Font](Font.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A variation of a font with additional settings.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Provides OpenType variations, simulated bold / slant, and additional font settings like OpenType features and extra spacing.

To use simulated bold font variant:




```gdscript
    var fv = FontVariation.new()
    fv.base_font = load("res://BarlowCondensed-Regular.ttf")
    fv.variation_embolden = 1.2
    $Label.add_theme_font_override("font", fv)
    $Label.add_theme_font_size_override("font_size", 64)
```


```csharp
    var fv = new FontVariation();
    fv.SetBaseFont(ResourceLoader.Load<FontFile>("res://BarlowCondensed-Regular.ttf"));
    fv.SetVariationEmbolden(1.2);
    GetNode("Label").AddThemeFontOverride("font", fv);
    GetNode("Label").AddThemeFontSizeOverride("font_size", 64);
```




To set the coordinate of multiple variation axes:

```
    var fv = FontVariation.new();
    var ts = TextServerManager.get_primary_interface()
    fv.base_font = load("res://BarlowCondensed-Regular.ttf")
    fv.variation_opentype = { ts.name_to_tag("wght"): 900, ts.name_to_tag("custom_hght"): 900 }
```

## Property Descriptions

<a id="FontVariation_property_base_font"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Font](Font.md) **base_font** [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_base_font)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_base_font**\ (\ value\: [Font](Font.md)\ )
- [Font](Font.md) **get_base_font**\ (\ )

Base font used to create a variation. If not set, default [Theme](Theme.md) font is used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-property -->

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_baseline_offset**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_baseline_offset**\ (\ )

Extra baseline offset (as a fraction of font height).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FontVariation_property_opentype_features"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **opentype_features** = `{}` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_opentype_features)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_opentype_features**\ (\ value\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ )
- [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **get_opentype_features**\ (\ )

A set of OpenType feature tags. More info: [OpenType feature tags](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/featuretags).

- [int](int.md) **get_spacing**\ (\ )

Extra spacing at the bottom of the line in pixels.

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_spacing**\ (\ spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_spacing**\ (\ )

Extra spacing between graphical glyphs.

- `void` **set_spacing**\ (\ spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_spacing**\ (\ )

Extra width of the space glyphs.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **spacing_top** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_spacing_top)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_spacing**\ (\ spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_spacing**\ (\ )

Extra spacing at the top of the line in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FontVariation_property_variation_embolden"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **variation_embolden** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_variation_embolden)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_variation_embolden**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_variation_embolden**\ (\ )

If is not equal to zero, emboldens the font outlines. Negative values reduce the outline thickness.

\ **Note:** Emboldened fonts might have self-intersecting outlines, which will prevent MSDF fonts and [TextMesh](TextMesh.md) from working correctly.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FontVariation_property_variation_face_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **variation_face_index** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_variation_face_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_variation_face_index**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_variation_face_index**\ (\ )

Active face index in the TrueType / OpenType collection file.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FontVariation_property_variation_opentype"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **variation_opentype** = `{}` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_variation_opentype)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_variation_opentype**\ (\ value\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ )
- [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **get_variation_opentype**\ (\ )

Font OpenType variation coordinates. More info: [OpenType variation tags](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/dvaraxisreg).

\ **Note:** This [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) uses OpenType tags as keys. Variation axes can be identified both by tags ([int](int.md), e.g. ``0x77678674``) and names ([String](String.md), e.g. ``wght``). Some axes might be accessible by multiple names. For example, ``wght`` refers to the same axis as ``weight``. Tags on the other hand are unique. To convert between names and tags, use [TextServer.name_to_tag()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_name_to_tag) and [TextServer.tag_to_name()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_tag_to_name).

\ **Note:** To get available variation axes of a font, use [Font.get_supported_variation_list()](Font.md#Font_method_get_supported_variation_list).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FontVariation_property_variation_transform"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **variation_transform** = `Transform2D(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_property_variation_transform)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_variation_transform**\ (\ value\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md)\ )
- [Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **get_variation_transform**\ (\ )

2D transform, applied to the font outlines, can be used for slanting, flipping and rotating glyphs.

For example, to simulate italic typeface by slanting, apply the following transform ``Transform2D(1.0, slant, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0)``.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

## Method Descriptions

<a id="FontVariation_method_set_spacing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_spacing**\ (\ spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#FontVariation_method_set_spacing)

Sets the spacing for `spacing` to `value` in pixels (not relative to the font size).
